member.name: M:FluentValidation.AbstractValidator`1.Custom(System.Func{`0,FluentValidation.Results.ValidationFailure})
member.summary: Defines a custom validation rule using a lambda expression. If the validation rule fails, it should return a instance of a ValidationFailure If the validation rule succeeds, it should return null.
member.param: A lambda that executes custom validation rules.

member.name: T:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods that provide the default set of validators.

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.NotNull``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1})
member.summary: Defines a 'not null' validator on the current rule builder. Validation will fail if the property is null.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.NotEmpty``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1})
member.summary: Defines a 'not empty' validator on the current rule builder. Validation will fail if the property is null, an empty or the default value for the type (for example, 0 for integers)
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.Length``1(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Defines a length validator on the current rule builder, but only for string properties. Validation will fail if the length of the string is outside of the specifed range. The range is inclusive.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.Matches``1(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Defines a regular expression validator on the current rule builder, but only for string properties. Validation will fail if the value returned by the lambda does not match the regular expression.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The regular expression to check the value against.

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.EmailAddress``1(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,System.String})
member.summary: Defines a regular expression validator on the current rule builder, but only for string properties. Validation will fail if the value returned by the lambda is not a valid email address.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.NotEqual``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},``1)
member.summary: Defines a 'not equal' validator on the current rule builder. Validation will fail if the specified value is equal to the value of the property.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value to compare

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.NotEqual``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Defines a 'not equal' validator on the current rule builder using a lambda to specify the value. Validation will fail if the value returned by the lambda is equal to the value of the property.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
A lambda expression to provide the comparison value

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.Equal``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},``1)
member.summary: Defines an 'equals' validator on the current rule builder. Validation will fail if the specified value is not equal to the value of the property.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value to compare

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.Equal``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Defines an 'equals' validator on the current rule builder using a lambda to specify the comparison value. Validation will fail if the value returned by the lambda is not equal to the value of the property.
member.typeparam: The type of object being validated
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
A lambda expression to provide the comparison value

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.Must``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},System.Func{``1,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Defines a predicate validator on the current rule builder using a lambda expression to specify the predicate. Validation will fail if the specified lambda returns false. Validation will succeed if the specifed lambda returns true.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
A lambda expression specifying the predicate

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.Must``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``1,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Defines a predicate validator on the current rule builder using a lambda expression to specify the predicate. Validation will fail if the specified lambda returns false. Validation will succeed if the specifed lambda returns true. This overload accepts the object being validated in addition to the property being validated.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
A lambda expression specifying the predicate

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.LessThan``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},``1)
member.summary: Defines a 'less than' validator on the current rule builder. The validation will succeed if the property value is less than the specified value. The validation will fail if the property value is greater than or equal to the specified value.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value being compared

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.LessThanOrEqualTo``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},``1)
member.summary: Defines a 'less than or equal' validator on the current rule builder. The validation will succeed if the property value is less than or equal to the specified value. The validation will fail if the property value is greater than the specified value.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value being compared

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.GreaterThan``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},``1)

member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value being compared

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.GreaterThanOrEqualTo``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},``1)
member.summary: Defines a 'less than' validator on the current rule builder. The validation will succeed if the property value is greater than or equal the specified value. The validation will fail if the property value is less than the specified value.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value being compared

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.LessThan``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Defines a 'less than' validator on the current rule builder using a lambda expression. The validation will succeed if the property value is less than the specified value. The validation will fail if the property value is greater than or equal to the specified value.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
A lambda that should return the value being compared

member.name: M:FluentValidation.DefaultValidatorExtensions.LessThanOrEqualTo``2(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Defines a 'less than or equal' validator on the current rule builder using a lambda expression. The validation will succeed if the property value is less than or equal to the specified value. The validation will fail if the property value is greater than the specified value.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value being compared

member.summary: Defines a 'less than' validator on the current rule builder using a lambda expression. The validation will succeed if the property value is greater than the specified value. The validation will fail if the property value is less than or equal to the specified value.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validator should be defined
The value being compared
